intro: Petroselinum crispum, commonly known as parsley, is a biennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its finely divided, bright green leaves and small white or yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like carrots and dill. Its leaves are often used as a garnish or culinary herb, while the roots can be used in cooking or as a spice. Petroselinum crispum thrives in cool climates and well-drained soil.
